result.execSummary:
The defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surchare, Court costs, fees, assesments and surcharges.
If in Wisconsin State prison due to revocation, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon shall be due immediately.
In alternative, if not in WSP, to be paid in full by 10/1/2015.   Any bail to aply. Any remaining shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

***ORDER GRANTING REQUEST FOR SENTENCE CREDIT; the defendant is granted an additional 15 days of credit for as TOTAL credit of 104 days dated December 22, 2014/Judge Stark.***
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  Release for the Day Reporting Center only. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

Provide a DNA sample if not  already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Clerical Error: The Plea and Sentencing date was entered on 9-29-2014 and the Plea and Sentencing took place on 9-26-2014.
14A 032222/reversed on 10/10/14 by S.R.

Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT  1:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; with release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY; credit for 89 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
If in Wisconsin State Prison due to revocation: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance upon shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
In alternative if not in Wisconsin State Prison: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid in full by 10-1-2015. Any cash bail to apply. Any remaining shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Defense requests release privileges for medical release. Court denies the Defense requests for release privileges for medical release. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 9-26-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Summary dated August 15, 2014, received and filed.

Attorney Mary D. Scholle in court, defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court denied State's motion for modification of bail at this time.  Same bail/same conditions ($500.00 cash which has already been posted).  Effective August 3, 2014, this case will be assigned to Judge Carolina Stark, Branch 17, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served; original in court.  Case set for bail/bond review on 8-1-14, 8:30.  Attorney Scholle and ADA Hauer notified via e-mail.  alp
Justice Point violation received and filed (new arrest).  Case in bench warrant status, no action taken at this time.  alp
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley not in court.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Bail not forfeited at this time.

Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-16-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Suppress Proceeded.  
Sworn for the State:  Officer Michael Martin, MPD, Officer Christopher Schlachter, MPD.   Parties rest. Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made by the State and defense.  Based on all filings, testimony and evidence in court, the court  finds that there was probable cause for the stop, which was not contested, therefore the search of the vehicle and seizure of evidence were legal.  Therefore, the court DENIED defense motion to suppress.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   Original scheduling order not filed.  Defense motion not filed timely.  State's key witness unavailable to appear this date.  Case rescheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for 05-23-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the State:  Response to Defense Motion to Suppress
14RM021493  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04/21/2014 lj

Attorney Mary D Scholle in court, defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley not in court, in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  FILE NOT IN COURT. Partis stipulate to amendment of bail.  All conditions of bail remain the same.  Case remains set for motion hearing on 4-29-14, 1:30 p.m.

Attorney Mary D Scholle in court, defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.   Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #08CF6379 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Sergio Rentas-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.

Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in custody.  Kevin Shomin for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Romeo Denzell Veasley in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
